name: Destructible Cover
description: Objects used as cover have AC and Hit Points. When an attack misses a creature behind cover but the attack roll equals or exceeds the cover object's AC, the attack hits the cover instead, dealing damage to it. When cover is reduced to 0 HP, it is destroyed and no longer provides cover.

coverDamageRule.trigger: An attack roll misses the target creature but equals or exceeds the AC of the cover object
coverDamageRule.result: The attack hits the cover object instead, dealing damage to it
coverDamageRule.destruction: When an object is reduced to 0 HP, it is destroyed and no longer provides any cover

objectHP.description: An object's HP is based on its size and resilience. The DM sets HP based on the object's material and construction.

mechanics.objectImmunities: Objects are immune to Poison and Psychic damage. The DM may decide that certain objects have resistance or immunity to other damage types (e.g., a stone wall is immune to Slashing damage).
mechanics.damageThreshold: Some large or magically reinforced objects have a damage threshold. An object with a damage threshold is immune to damage from any single source unless the damage equals or exceeds the threshold.

interactions: This adds tactical depth by making cover a depletable resource that attackers can destroy over time
High-damage attacks are more effective at destroying cover than multiple weak attacks, especially against objects with damage thresholds
Area-of-effect spells like Fireball can damage cover objects in the area, potentially destroying multiple pieces of cover at once
Creatures relying on half cover (+2 AC) or three-quarters cover (+5 AC) must be aware that their protection can be stripped away
This rule interacts with the Shatter spell, which deals Thunder damage specifically targeting objects and has double damage against nonmagical objects
